Description: Fragment of wall of Attic red-figured pottery bell- or calyx krater. Inside glazed; outside, probably a maenad and a satyr; to the left, parallel diagonal lines, perhaps a thyrsus or drapery; to right a tambourine, then the upper arm of a male.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 104 no. 364 pl. 78)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1133)
